meanings.definition: The act of allocating a portion of something to a smaller division or category.
meanings.sent1: The suballocation of funds to different departments helps in efficient budget management.
meanings.sent2: Each team received a suballocation of tasks to complete by the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: The suballocation of snacks at the party led to a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her suballocation of time between work and hobbies was like balancing on a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: The suballocation of colors in the painting made it visually appealing.

meanings.definition: A specific portion or share that has been allocated to a smaller division or category.
meanings.sent1: The suballocation of the budget to marketing was crucial for the campaign's success.
meanings.sent2: Each student was given a suballocation of space in the classroom for their personal belongings.
meanings.sent3: The suballocation of toys among the children sparked a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: His suballocation of responsibilities to his team members showed his trust in their abilities.
meanings.sent5: The suballocation of ingredients in the recipe resulted in a delicious dish.
